lines.text: [first lines]

[Backstage at the final performance of "Melodies of 1914" the producer is handing out pay envelopes to the chorus]
Ooooh! I'll be missing you next Saturday night, Pop!
And I'll be missing you, too, Miss Maisie.

[Taking her pay envelope]
Yeah, but you won't be missing this, and I will. Guess I shouldn't kick. Two weeks is a long run these days.
[She heads for her dressing room]
C'mon Suzy, let's get dressed.
Alright Maisie, I'll be right with ya.

[to Suzy, crying]
But it's your whole week's salary, Suzy. I won't take it. You can't afford it!
Don't you worry about me; blondes never go broke. Being a brunette, you wouldn't understand that. But you very seldom catch a blonde in financial trouble. Besides, I've got a rich uncle.
But you never told me you had any relatives in London.
I haven't got any relatives anywhere, but I've got a rich uncle. Now monkey, you take that.
Aha... Jealous?

[Looking at a photograph of a beautiful woman in Andre's room]
Yes, terribly jealous. Jealous of all the years I didn't know you and jealous of everything that might take you away from me.
I love Andre. I can't lose him.

I'll tell you what you don't want to lose. Your soft easy life, your nice clothes and your luxury. You don't want to lose a single room in that elegant house of yours. Suzy Trent on her way up. That's why you haven't told Andre the truth.
[Starts to leave]
Where are you going?
To tell Andre everything.
You haven't the nerve.
[She leaves]
This is my luckiest day but maybe you'll have regrets. Be disillusioned.
Darling, I don't even know how to spell those words.

[to Maisie]
Listen, it's just as easy to fall for a big shot as it is a little one.
Do you suppose you could give me some lines in the show?

[Looking her over]
You've got some rather nice lines now.
I mean... would you let me play a small part?
That depends upon how big a part you're willing to let me play.
Oh, well, what time should I report tomorrow?

[Making a move]
Tomorrow? You're having dinner with me tonight.

[Resisting]
You're mistaken about dinner. I was speaking of rehearsals.
Well, in that case, perhaps you're mistaken about rehearsals. I... I don't think you want to be, uh, the type.
Do you like onions?
Onions for two are delicious. For one they're a terrible hazard.
